data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When facing forward, you always walk in a forward direction. When facing backward, you take your right foot in the direction you were walking in. If you go backward, only take 10 steps backward with your left foot in the same direction of place you were walking and your right foot in the same direction of place you were walking in prior. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps to the right and you will be redirected to turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Follow the instruction to take 6 steps + 4 steps + 10 steps + 4 steps = 21 steps. A circular motion repeats itself. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can return to the starting point by taking 1 step and 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you return to the starting point, you need to move the left foot in one direction. Turn left twice more and again turn left. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person doesn’t have to take 7 steps to go back from the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 8 steps, take 9 steps. Turn left. Take 8, Take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around means taking 8 steps first. Taking 2 steps means 8 steps first, to turn around is 6 steps second. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone starts facing forward and takes 4 steps forward, they proceed to take 4 steps left. When someone takes 6 steps forward from where they started, they return to where they started. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

This is a list of all the different ways you can take 4 steps. If you take 2 steps, you are doing this all at once. If you take 3 steps and turn around, you are taking 3 + 9 = 23 steps. This is a list of all the different ways you can take 6 steps. The directions list 23 different ways. So, the answer is Yes.

It takes 2 steps to take 1 step backward. It takes 2 steps to take 2 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you will get lost if you take 9 steps backward. The starting point is always facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Move the entire body in one direction for 10 steps to take 9 steps left. Move the entire body in one direction for 9 steps to take 10 steps left. Repeat directions and make 5 different steps in each direction. Take 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 4 steps left and 3 steps forward. Thus, there are 4 steps left + 4 steps right = 12 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take three steps right takes you one step backward. Take 6 steps left takes you one step forward. In turn, take three steps right takes you one step forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Turn around is the first point you would turn from right to left. Take 4 steps is the first point you would take from right to left. So, the answer is Yes.

Walking in the first direction takes 3 steps in the first direction. Turning round takes 2 steps and this way you would only be taking 10 steps total to turn around. Walking in the second direction takes 2 steps in the first direction. Turning around takes 10 steps total to turn around. So, the answer is no.

You always forward. 7 steps are 7 left steps. 5 steps backward. There are 3 steps backward. 7 steps forward. 2 steps right. You take 7 left. 7 steps backward.
